message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.CV

The paper deals with optimization problems that involve inner loops or sequences of increasingly costly approximations, which are common in machine learning and optimization. The paper proposes a new method for estimating gradients, called randomized telescope (RT) gradient estimators, which can provide cheap unbiased gradient estimates. The paper evaluates the proposed method on a range of applications including meta-optimization of learning rates, variational inference of ODE parameters, and training an LSTM to model long sequences. Based on this, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.SY (Systems and Control), and cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition).
